occurrences.text: what his younger son had done unto him. He was aware of that which had transpired, he was aware of what had taken place when he was within his tent. We find that he then, as he has this understanding of the events, God records for us in verses 25 through 27, if you're taking notes, number three, the prophecy of Noah. As we look at the prophecy of Noah, we break down these verses of Scripture in verses 25 through 27, it actually becomes a little bit clearer as to what happens not only here in Genesis 9, but you'll be familiar with this taking place later in the life of Jacob. Remember when he calls all of his boys around in Genesis chapter number 49, and he's going to give the blessings to all of his sons, and he goes through and he lists each of the sons and he speaks about them and so on and so forth, and we find here that as Noah, the prophecy of Noah is recorded for us in verses 25 through 27. Now it begins in verse number 25 with dealing, and here's what it says, and he said, Cursed be Canaan, a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren. We understand that as this prophecy of Noah is recorded for us here in verses 25 through 27, that it begins with a curse. We'll find that
